intro: Vochysia ingens, commonly known as the giant vochysia, is a large evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, cream-colored flowers. The plant produces woody capsules as fruits, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its size and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
